items.title: RWAEX Features Overview
items.content:
RWAEX Exchange provides comprehensive financial services, supporting the deposit and withdrawal of multiple fiat and crypto. You can enjoy the following services at RWAEX:

- Fiat Deposit: Deposit fiat into yourRWAEX’s account through bank transfer, with zero fees.

- Fiat Withdrawal: Easily withdraw fiat from your RWAEX’s account to your bank account.

- Crypto Deposit: Deposit crypto assets into your RWAEX’s account through blockchain networks, with zero fees.

- Crypto Withdrawal: Quickly transfer crypto assets from your RWAEX’s account to your wallet.

- Spot Trade: Offers a high liquidity, multi-currency spot trade market, with zero fees.

- Fiat flash remittance: Realize quick transfers of fiat within RWAEX, with zero fees.

- Rapid buy: Provides instant exchange between fiat and crypto, with zero fees.

- Foreign Exchange: Supports convenient conversion between different fiat, meeting international transaction and payment needs, with zero fees.

- Internal Transfer: Realize quick transfers of cryptos within RWAEX, with zero fees.

Come and follow us to explore more exciting content with us!

items.title: RWAEX Exchange's 6 Exclusive Rewards
items.content:
THE EVENT IS ONGOING

Detailed Event Rules

1. Deposit Reward: Deposit Now and Earn 3 USD

(1) Rules: Deposit any amount in CNH, HKD, USD, or EUR to earn 3 USD.

(2) Details: Each account can claim the reward only once. The 3 USD reward will be directly credited to your USD balance.

(3) Note: While there is no minimum deposit amount, please consider potential bank transfer fees.


2. Withdrawal Reward: Withdraw Now and Earn 3 USD

(1) Rules: Withdraw an equivalent of 65 USD or more in CNH, HKD, USD, or EUR to earn 3 USD.

(2) Details: Each account can claim the reward only once. The 3 USD reward will be credited to your USD balance within 24 hours after the withdrawal is successfully processed.

(3) Note: A service fee will be charged by RWAEX, which does not include any potential transfer fees that may be charged by banks.


3. Share Reward: Share Now and Earn 2 CNH

(1) Rules: Share the event link on your X (formerly Twitter) or Telegram account to earn 2 CNH. 

(2) Details: You can claim the reward once per platform, with a maximum of 4 CNH. The reward will be credited to your CNH balance within 24 hours after the share is verified.  

(3) Note: Please fill out the designated official form with your sharing details, including your social media account and the shared link.


4. Fee-Free Reward: Trade with Zero Fees

(1) Rules: During the event period, all users can deposit, conduct flash remittance, rapid buy, foreign exchange, and trade on the RWAEX Exchange platform without any commission fees.

(2) Details: This reward does not include the service fee charged during withdrawals.

(3) Note: Although RWAEX does not charge fees, banks may impose transfer fees during deposits and withdrawals. Please be aware of this.


5. Withdrawal Reward: Win an iPhone 16

(1) Rules: During the event period, the user with the highest total withdrawal amount will win the latest iPhone 16.

(2) Details: The winner will be notified via their registered email address. Please follow the instructions in the email to provide the necessary information.

(3) Note: In the event of identical total withdrawal amounts, the winner will be determined by the time the amount was reached. Please ensure your contact information is accurate.


6. Transfer Reward: Up to 100 USD

(1) Rules: Complete 1 flash remittance, rapid buy, or foreign exchange transaction to earn 10 transfer chances, with a maximum of 30 transfer chances available.

(2) Details: Each transfer chance can randomly yield between 1 and 100 USD. The reward will be directly credited to your USD balance. 

(3) Note: Transfer chances must be used within the event period; any unused chances will expire. Each account is limited to a maximum of 30 transfer chances.


Important Notes

1. This event is limited to the first 1,000 eligible users.

2. All rewards have no expiration date and can be kept in your RWAEX account for the long term.

3. You can check your rewards on the "Asset Details – Event Rewards" page in the RWAEX Exchange app or official website, or receive notifications about your rewards via internal messages and email.

4. RWAEX Exchange reserves the right to the final interpretation of the event, including but not limited to the right to modify the event rules, suspend, or terminate the event.


Q&A

1.How long will it take for my reward to arrive?

RWAEX will issue the reward immediately after confirming that you have completed the activity tasks.

You can check your reward in Assets > Currency (USD/CNH) > History.


2.How to participate in the Share Reward?

Share the event information on X: Please follow us and share the event content on your X account. Once completed, enter the link to your post in the share field.


Share the event information on Telegram:

  - Join our community on Telegram.

  - Find the second pinned message RWAEX Exchange's 6 Exclusive Rewards Event and share it with your friends.

  - After sharing, take a screenshot of the shared message and upload it to the share field on the event page.


Important Notes:

Each user is only eligible for one share reward, so please ensure the accuracy of the information you submit.

If you participate in sharing activities on both X and Telegram, please complete the shares on both platforms before submitting your proof of participation in a single entry.


3.Why can't I see the entry for the Share Reward?

After you participate in the Deposit Reward and Withdrawal Reward and successfully receive the rewards, the entry for the Share Reward will be automatically unlocked.


4.Can I claim rewards multiple times?

The Deposit Reward and Withdrawal Reward can only be claimed once. The Share Reward can be claimed twice (once per social platform). The Transfer Reward can be claimed up to 30 times.


5.How much fee do I have to pay to complete these transactions?

For deposit, Flash Remittance, Rapid Buy, Foreign Exchange, and spot transactions on RWAEX, there are no fees. RWAEX only charges 1% service fee for fail withdrawals and 0.5% service fee for crypto withdrawals. (The fees mentioned do not include any transfer fees charged by banks during deposit and withdrawal transactions.)

1. Change the country/region of your existing Apple ID:

  - You can choose to change the country/region of your existing Apple ID to Panama or Micronesia. You can refer to the video tutorial we provide for the operation steps.

 

2. Register a new Apple ID:

  - If you need to create a new Apple ID and set the "country/region" to Panama or Micronesia, we also offer a video tutorial for registration.

 

3. Download the RWAEX Exchange App:

  - Once your Apple ID is set up, you can directly search for "RWAEX Exchange" in the App Store, find our app, and download it.

items.title: How to Download APP on Android Devices
items.content:
Android users can download the APP through two methods: 

1. Search for "RWAEX Exchange" in the Google Play Store and download it. 

2. Scan the QR code below to download the APK file.

items.title: How to Register an Account
items.content:
We offer a variety of registration methods, including email registration, Apple ID registration, and Google account registration.

 

1. Email Registration:

  - Click the "Register" button and choose to register as an individual or institution user.

  - Enter your email address.

  - Set a secure password.

  - Enter the verification code received in your email.

  - After completing these steps, your account will be successfully registered.

 

2. Apple ID Registration:

  - Click the "Register" button and choose to register as an individual or institution user.

  - On the registration page, select "Apple ID" as the login method.

  - Use your Apple ID for quick registration.

  - Enter the verification code received in your Apple ID email.

  - After completing the verification, your account will be successfully registered.

  If your Apple ID is only linked with a phone number and not an email, you will not be able to register quickly through your Apple ID.

 

3. Google Account Registration:

  - Click the "Register" button and choose to register as an individual or institution user.

  - On the registration page, select "Google Account" as the login method.

  - Use your Google account for quick registration.

  - Enter the verification code received in your Gmail email.

  - After completing the verification, your account will be successfully registered.

Click Here to View the Video Tutorial

items.title: How to Update APP on iOS Devices
items.content:
Apple users can update RWAEX Exchange through the App Store. If you encounter any issues during the update process, please check the following conditions:

 

1. Make sure that the Apple ID you are currently using is registered in Panama or Micronesia.

 

2. Ensure that you are logged in with the same Apple ID that was used to initially download the APP.

 

3. Verify that your current network is not located within Mainland China.

 

4. If your APP version is too old or for other reasons cannot be upgraded, try uninstalling the APP first, and then download the latest version again.

items.title: How to Update APP on Android Devices
items.content:
Android users can update RWAEX Exchange by searching for it on Google Play. If you encounter any issues during the update process, please check the following conditions:

 

1. Please ensure that your app was downloaded through the Google Play Store. If you previously installed it using an APK file, you will need to uninstall the current version first and then download and install it again through Google Play.

 

2. Make sure that your current network is not located within Mainland China.

 

3. If your APP version is too old or for other reasons cannot be upgraded, try uninstalling the APP first, and then download the latest version again.

items.title: How to Unbind Google Authenticator
items.content:
Google Authenticator is an important security measure, serving as an additional layer of protection for your account and a necessary condition for completing many transactions. If you are certain that you want to unbind it, please follow these detailed steps:

 

1. Log in to your account

  - Open the APP, find and tap the RWA icon in the top left corner of the page to enter the user center.

 

2. Enter security settings

  - Tap UID, find the "Security" option, and then select "Google Authenticator."

  - Tap "Unbind."

 

3. Security verification

  - During the unbinding process, the system will ask you to enter a verification code from your email as well as a verification code generated by Google Authenticator.

 

If you are using the WEB interface, please follow these detailed steps:

 

1. Log in to your account

  - After logging in, find the avatar icon in the top right corner of the page.

 

2. Enter security settings

  - Click on the "Security" option, and then click "Unbind" next to "Google Authenticator."

 

3. Security verification

  - During the unbinding process, the system will ask you to enter a verification code from your email as well as a verification code generated by Google Authenticator.

 Click to Unbind Immediately

 

Please note that within 24 hours after unbinding Google Authenticator, you will not be able to perform fiat withdrawals, crypto withdrawals, fiat flash remittances, or crypto internal transfers.

2. Enter security settings

3. Unbind the original Google Authenticator

  - During the unbinding process, the system will ask you to enter a verification code from your email and a verification code generated by the original Google Authenticator.

items.title: What is Google Authenticator
items.content:
1. What is Google Authenticator? 

Google Authenticator is a dynamic password tool launched by Google. It generates dynamic verification codes based on the Time-based One-Time Password (TOTP) algorithm, providing additional protection for user accounts, used for 2FA (Two-Factor Authentication).

 

2. What is 2FA? 

2FA stands for "Two-Factor Authentication," which is a security verification mechanism that requires users to provide two different forms of identity verification information when logging in or performing sensitive operations. The relationship between Google Authenticator and 2FA is that it is a common implementation method of 2FA. By adding a dynamically generated verification code in addition to a password, it enhances the security of the account.

 

3. How to use Google Authenticator?

The process of using Google Authenticator is divided into two stages. The first stage is when the user enables Google Authenticator by scanning the QR code provided by the website to store the secret key in the authenticator client. The second stage is when the user logs in with the authenticator; Google Authenticator generates a six-digit password using the TOTP algorithm every 30 seconds, and the user enters this password on the website to complete the login.

 

The features of Google Authenticator include automatic setup through QR codes, support for multiple accounts, and support for various languages. Additionally, Google Authenticator was updated in April 2023 to add cloud synchronization functionality, allowing users to sync their 2FA tokens with their Google account, enabling access and backup across devices. This update has increased the convenience of Google Authenticator, especially for users who lose their devices or need to switch between multiple devices.

items.title: Why Isn't My Email Being Received
items.content:
The actual arrival time of the email may vary due to network differences among different email service providers. If you have not received the verification code sent by us, please check the following conditions:

 

1. Check email space: Please ensure that your email account has enough space to receive new emails.

 

2. Check spam/junk mail: Sometimes emails may be mistakenly categorized into the spam or advertising folders. Please check these folders.

 

3. Request to resend: Try to send the email again to test whether the email system is working properly.

 

4. Consider network delays: The delivery of emails may be affected by the network conditions of the email service provider. Such delays are usually temporary, and emails will generally arrive shortly.

 

5. Avoid frequent requests: If you request to send the email multiple times in a short period, the system might identify it as potential risky behavior. In this case, please wait for a while before trying again.

items.title: Password Setting Standards
items.content:
To ensure the security of your account, please follow these rules when setting your password:

 

- The password length must be between 8 and 20 characters.

- It must contain at least 1 uppercase letter.

- It must contain at least 1 lowercase letter. 

- It must contain at least 1 number.

- It must contain at least 1 special character.

items.title: Individual Identity Verification
items.content:
The individual identity verification process is an important step to ensure account security and compliance with regulatory requirements. You will need to fill out personal information, upload identification documents, link a bank account, and complete a deposit. Here are the detailed verification steps:

 

1. Fill in personal information

  - Please provide your full name, nationality, and date of birth in English.

  - Please note that, as per regulations, only adults over the age of 18 are eligible to open an account.

 

2. Upload personal identification documents

  - You will need to provide a valid personal identification document. We accept passports and identity cards for identity verification.

  - Please take clear photos of your identification documents, including both sides of your passport or identity card, as well as a photo of you holding the document, ensuring that your face and document information are clearly visible.

 

3. Link a bank account

  - Please link your own bank account to the "Bank Account Whitelist" . Do not link someone else's account, as this will not pass the review. Please accurately fill in the following information:

    - Full name of the bank

    - Bank account number

    - Location of the bank account

    - SWIFT CODE

    - Bank code (If Any)

    - Bank address

 

4. Account verification

  - Please transfer any amount to the dedicated account opened by RWA at bank transfer to verify your identity.

  - Ensure that the currency you transfer and the account match the account information you have linked in RWA.

  - If you need to change the currency of the payment account, please re-link the "Whitelist of Bank Accounts" on the RWA platform first.

 

After completing the above steps, RWA will review the information you have submitted. During the review process, if there are any issues with your documents, we may ask you to resubmit them. Once the review is passed, you will be able to participate in all trading and services provided by RWA. Until the review result is out, your account will not be able to conduct any trading activities.

Click Here to View the Video Tutorial﻿

items.title: What is Identity Verification
items.content:
1. What is Identity Verification?

Identity verification, commonly referred to as KYC (Know Your Customer), is the process by which institutions legally validate a user's identity, understand their financial status, transaction purposes, and background information. This is a core compliance measure in the financial industry, aimed at ensuring the authenticity of user identities and the legality of transactions, preventing financial crimes, money laundering, and terrorist financing, among other illegal activities.


2. The Origin of Identity Verification

  - The Surge in Financial Crimes

  •    Towards the end of the 20th century, globalization and digitalization led to an increase in cross-border financial transactions. However, this also became a tool for criminals to launder money and finance terrorism.
  •    After the 911 attacks in 2001, the international community discovered the covert methods terrorists used to raise funds through the financial system, highlighting the importance of KYC and AML (Anti-Money Laundering) regulations.

  - International Response

  •    In the 1990s, the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) established a series of anti-money laundering guidelines, prompting countries to develop KYC systems.
  •    The USA PATRIOT Act (2001) explicitly required financial institutions to strengthen customer identity scrutiny.

  - The Rise of Digital Currencies

  •    With the emergence of blockchain technology, digital currencies (such as Bitcoin) have become significant tools for money laundering and illegal transactions due to their anonymity. Regulatory authorities around the world have quickly increased KYC requirements for digital currency exchanges.


3. Why Conduct Identity Verification

  - To Guard Against Financial Crimes

  •     AML: Criminals use complex fund transfers to conceal the sources of illicit gains. KYC prevents money laundering by verifying identities and monitoring account activities.

    For example: Without KYC, criminals can easily register multiple accounts, disperse illegal funds across different platforms, and then legitimize them through transactions.

  •     CFT (Counter-Terrorist Financing): Terrorist organizations often raise funds through seemingly ordinary transaction channels. KYC can verify the flow of funds and detect anomalies in a timely manner.

  - To Comply with Regulatory Requirements

  •     Major economies around the world have imposed strict KYC compliance requirements on financial institutions. Institutions that fail to meet these requirements may face heavy fines or have their licenses revoked.

    Case in point: In 2012, HSBC was fined $1.9 billion by the United States for lax anti-money laundering and KYC practices.

  - To Ensure Platform Security

  •     KYC helps prevent fraudulent activities such as identity theft, account hijacking, and the creation of fake accounts.
  •     In an environment without KYC, users may be at a higher risk of fraud.

  - To Build User Trust

  •     A comprehensive KYC process indicates that the platform values security and compliance, making users more inclined to establish long-term partnerships with such platforms.

  - To Enhance User Experience

  •    Compliant users can enjoy smoother services, such as faster withdrawals and higher transaction limits.

 

Identity verification is a vital cornerstone of the modern financial system. It is not just a technical process but also an essential measure to prevent crime and maintain economic order.

items.title: Institutional Identity Verification
items.content:
The institutional identity verification process is an important step to ensure account security and compliance with regulatory requirements. You will need to fill out basic institutional information, provide key business documents, link a bank account, and complete a deposit. Here are the detailed verification steps:

 

1. Fill in institutional information:

  - Please accurately fill in the basic information of the institution in English.

  - Please ensure that the business is currently in good standing and that a company account has been opened.

 

2. Upload business documents:

  - Provide valid business identification documents.

 

3. Link a bank account:

  - Add your bank account to the "Bank Account Whitelist" and ensure not to use someone else's or another institution's account to avoid failing the review. Please accurately fill in the following information:

    - Full name of the bank where the account is held

    - Bank account number

    - Location of the bank account

    - SWIFT CODE

    - Bank number (If Any)

    - Bank address

 

4. Account verification:

  - Transfer any amount to the dedicated account opened by RWA at bank transfer to verify your identity.

  - Ensure that the currency you transfer and the account match the account information you have linked in RWA.

  - If you need to change the currency of the payment account, please re-link the "Bank Account Whitelist" on the RWA platform first.

 

After completing the above steps, RWA will review the information you have submitted. During the review process, if there are any issues with your documents, we may ask you to resubmit them. Once the review is passed, you will be able to participate in all trading and services provided by RWA. Until the review result is out, your account will not be able to conduct any trading activities.

Click Here to View the Video Tutorial

items.title: How to Trade Before ID Verification
items.content:
When you select the "Proceed with Identity Verification" option, you will need to complete the following steps:

 

1. Fill in personal information: You are required to provide comprehensive personal details.

 

2. Submit identification documents: Upload valid identification documents for us to verify your identity.

 

3. Complete a bank deposit: Make at least one bank deposit to verify your account information.

 

After completing the above steps, your information will enter the review process. Until the review is approved, you will not be able to participate in any trading activities. Please wait patiently for the outcome of the review.

items.title: Can Mainland Chinese Residents Register with ID/Passport
items.content: RWAEX Exchange does not provide services to Mainland China. In accordance with regulatory compliance requirements, if you hold an ID card or passport from Mainland China, your identity verification application will not pass our review process. We understand that this may cause inconvenience to you. For any inconvenience caused, we sincerely apologize and suggest that you follow our official announcements for the latest service updates.

- Euro (EUR)

- British Pound (GBP)

- New Zealand Dollar (NZD)

- Canadian Dollar (CAD)

- Norwegian Krone (NOK)

- Swiss Franc (CHF)

- Thai Baht (THB)

Soon to be available

- Brunei Dollar (BND)

- Danish Krone (DKK)

- South African Rand (ZAR)


The above currencies cover multiple major economies around the globe, meeting your diverse financial needs on RWAEX.

items.title: How Long Does It Take for Fiat Deposits to Credit
items.content:
1. When transferring funds through a local bank in Hong Kong, the funds will generally be credited within 1 working day.

 

2. When transferring funds through a bank outside of Hong Kong, the funds will typically be credited within 1-5 working days.

 

3. After RWAEX receives your remittance, it will be credited in real-time. Following the credit, a few minutes of risk control review will be required, during which your funds will be shown as "Unavailable."

 

4. During public holidays (when the SWIFT system is closed or it is not a working day in Hong Kong), there may be a delay in your funds being credited.

items.title: Are Deposits from Non-Individual/Institutional Accounts Allowed
items.content:
In accordance with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter-Terrorist Financing (CFT) requirements, when conducting fiat deposits and withdrawals on RWAEX Exchange, individual users must use their own bank accounts, and institutional users must use their institution's bank accounts. This is to ensure the compliance of fund flows and to prevent money laundering and the movement of illicit funds.

 

1. Account Limitation: Each currency can only be linked to one whitelisted account to ensure that the sources and destinations of deposits and withdrawals are traceable and legal. If you need to deposit for different currencies, each currency will require a corresponding whitelisted account. For example, if you have already set up a whitelisted account for USD, then you will need to set up another whitelisted account for other currencies (such as CNH).

 

2. Non-Whitelist Account Restrictions: If you use a non-whitelisted account for deposits, or if the currency does not match the account, it will result in the deposit not being credited.

items.title: Why Is My Deposit Marked as "Unavailable"
items.content: In accordance with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter-Terrorist Financing (CFT) regulatory requirements, when making fiat deposits on RWAEX Exchange, a strict risk control review must be conducted to ensure the compliance of the transactions. Typically, this process takes 1 to 2 minutes. During the review period, your asset status will be displayed as "Unavailable." Once the review is approved, the asset status will change from "Unavailable" to "Available," which means your funds can begin to be traded.

items.title: Can I Use a Mainland Chinese Bank Account for Deposit
items.content: RWAEX's fiat deposit service currently only supports Offshore Chinese Yuan (CNH) and does not support Onshore Chinese Yuan (CNY). Therefore, you cannot use a bank account from Mainland China to make a deposit. If you need to deposit Chinese Yuan, please use a bank account that supports Offshore Chinese Yuan.

items.title: Can Deposits from Non-Whitelisted Accounts Be Credited
items.content:
When making a fiat currency deposit on RWAEX Exchange, please adhere to the following rules to ensure a smooth crediting process:

 

1. Whitelist Account Requirement: The deposit account must be on the whitelist; otherwise, the deposit will not be successfully credited. Only one whitelisted account can be linked per currency, and the same account can be linked to multiple different currencies.

 

2. Currency and Account Matching: If you need to make deposits for different currencies, each currency must have a corresponding whitelisted account. For example, if you already have a USD account as a whitelisted account, then you will need to set up another whitelisted account for other currencies (such as CNH).

 

3. Consequences of Depositing from a Non-Whitelist Account: If you use an account that is not on the whitelist to make a deposit, the funds will not be correctly credited.

items.title: Banks Accepted for Fiat Currency Deposits
items.content:
We support you in transferring funds to RWAEX's bank account through the vast majority of banks worldwide to complete fiat currency deposit.To ensure a smooth transfer, please confirm that your sending bank has joined the SWIFT system, and that your funds originate from a regulated country or region. Additionally, we do not accept transfers made through the following methods:

 

- Joint Account : Bank accounts owned by two or more individuals or entities.

 

- ACH: An electronic clearing house in the United States that processes bank payments through a centralized system, transferring funds from one bank account to another.

 

- FPS: A rapid payment system launched by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority , allowing users to make instant transfers using a mobile number, email address, FPS identification code, or by scanning a QR code.

 

- Wise: A financial technology company that provides international money transfer and currency exchange services, offering international remittance services.

 

- Payment Asia: An electronic commerce payment platform in Hong Kong.

items.title: GAS Fee Discrepancy during Withdrawal
items.content:
When making a crypto withdrawal, the system will estimate an approximate Gas fee based on the on-chain situation. Due to the dynamic nature of blockchain networks, Gas fees may vary.


1. When you initiate a withdrawal request, the system calculates an approximate Gas fee based on the current congestion and Gas price on the chain. This estimate is based on the current state of the blockchain network and may therefore fluctuate.


2. After the withdrawal operation is completed, it will undergo a few minutes of risk control review. This is to ensure the compliance and security of the transaction.


3. Due to the time difference between your operation and the actual time the funds are sent to the chain, the actual Gas fee may differ from the estimate. This is because the congestion level and Gas price of the blockchain network are constantly changing.


4. Changes in Gas fees can be caused by various factors, including the level of network congestion, the Gas prices set by miners, the complexity of the transaction, and the priority of the transaction.

During the withdrawal process, we will first conduct a few minutes of risk control review to ensure the compliance and security of the transaction. After the review is approved, your crypto will be sent to the designated blockchain address. Generally, your crypto will arrive within about 5 minutes, but the exact time may vary depending on the network conditions.

items.title: What’s Flash Remittance
items.content: RWAEX Exchange's Fiat Flash Remittance service is built on the latest artificial intelligence trading models. By authorizing automated trading programs, it enables fiat transfers to other RWAEX users.

items.title: Flash Remittance Execution Time
items.content:
After the remitter initiates a Fiat Flash Remittance, the payee needs to respond within the system by choosing to accept or refuse.

items.title: Foreign Exchange Rates
items.content:
Foreign Exchange services provided by RWAEX Exchange adhere to principles of transparency and compliance, ensuring that customers can exchange currencies at the fairest exchange rates.


1. Exchange Rate Benchmark: Our exchange rates are strictly based on the real-time rates of our partner banks, ensuring the fairness and market consistency of transactions.


2. Bank Execution: The entire foreign exchange operation is executed by our partner banks, with RWAEX Exchange providing customer support and assistance throughout the process without directly participating in foreign exchange trading.


3. Exchange Rate Information Acquisition: You can obtain current exchange rate information through the "Exchange Rates" published by the Hong Kong Association of Banks or other official channels to make informed exchange decisions.


4. Service Transparency: RWAEX Exchange does not set its own foreign exchange trading prices; we are committed to providing customers with a transparent and reliable trading platform.


5. Easy Operation: Through the RWAEX Exchange platform, customers can easily manage the exchange of different currencies without having to visit banks in person, saving time and costs.


6. Security and Compliance: We ensure that all currency exchange operations comply with regulatory requirements, protecting the security of customers' funds and privacy of information.


By exchanging currency through RWAEX Exchange, you can enjoy real-time exchange rates provided by banks and professional customer service, while avoiding direct involvement in complex foreign exchange market transactions, ensuring the safety and convenience of the exchange process.

items.content:
"Whitelist" is a mechanism used by RWAEX Exchange to ensure the security and compliance of transactions. It includes a list of accounts or addresses recognized and permitted by the platform to conduct transactions. The types of whitelists in RWAEX Exchange are categorized into the following four:


1. Bank Account Whitelist:

  - Refers to the bank accounts that users need to link when conducting fiat deposits and withdrawals. These accounts must be verified to ensure the compliance and security of fund flows. Accounts not on the whitelist cannot perform fiat deposits and withdrawals.


2. Crypto Whitelist:

  - Pertains to the addresses involved when users withdraw cryptos through the blockchain network. These addresses need to be authenticated to prevent illegal transactions and enhance transaction transparency.


3. Fiat Flash Remittance Whitelist:

  - Refers to the accounts that can receive funds when users conduct fiat flash remittance business on RWAEX Exchange. These UIDs are set as whitelisted to facilitate the swift processing of flash remittance transactions.


4. Internal Transfer Whitelist:

  - Refers to the accounts that can receive funds during internal transfers of cryptos on RWAEX Exchange. These UIDs are set as whitelisted to ensure the smooth and secure handling of internal transfers.

 

To ensure the smoothness of the transaction process, please set up the whitelist in advance according to specific business needs. For fiat deposit and withdrawal services, adding to the whitelist is a necessary step, with the following specific rules:

items.title: Understand Candlestick Charts
items.content:
1. What is a candlestick chart?

A candlestick chart, also known as a K-line chart or Japanese candlestick chart, is a graphical representation used to record and analyze price movements in financial markets. It originated in 18th-century Japan for tracking rice prices and has since been widely adopted for use in stocks, foreign exchange, futures, and other financial markets.


2. What are the components of a candlestick chart?

  - Real Body:

  The real body is the central rectangular part of the candlestick, showing the opening and closing prices.

  The color or filling of the real body typically indicates price movement: on many trading platforms, a white or green real body signifies a price increase (closing price is higher than the opening price), while a black or red real body indicates a price decrease (closing price is lower than the opening price).

  - Upper Shadow:

  The upper shadow is the thin line above the real body, extending to the highest price.

  The length of the upper shadow represents the gap between the highest price reached during the period and the top of the real body.

  A long upper shadow may indicate selling pressure, especially with high trading volume.

  - Lower Shadow:

  The lower shadow is the thin line below the real body, extending to the lowest price.

  The length of the lower shadow represents the gap between the lowest price reached during the period and the bottom of the real body.

  A long lower shadow may indicate buying interest, especially with significant purchases at lower prices.

  - Time Frame:

  Candlestick charts can be drawn based on different time frames, such as 15 minutes, 1 hour, 4 hours, daily, weekly, etc.

  The chosen time frame affects trading decisions and strategies; short-term traders may focus on shorter time frames, while long-term investors may pay attention to longer time frames.

  - Pattern Recognition:

  Traders predict market sentiment and potential price movements by recognizing specific candlestick patterns.

  Some common patterns include the hammer, engulfing pattern, doji, morning star, and evening star.

  - Volume:

  Volume is a key factor in confirming the strength of candlestick signals.

  High volume usually means that price movements are widely recognized by the market, while low volume may indicate low market participation.

  - Market Sentiment:

  The shape of the candlestick can reflect changes in market participants' emotions, such as panic selling or greedy buying.

  For example, a long lower shadow with a short real body may indicate active buying at lower prices, while a long upper shadow with a short real body may indicate selling pressure at higher prices.

  - Technical Analysis:

  Candlestick charts are one of the fundamental tools of technical analysis but are often used in conjunction with other indicators (such as moving averages, Relative Strength Index RSI, Bollinger Bands, etc.) for a more comprehensive market analysis.

  - Trading Decisions:

  Traders use candlestick charts to determine entry points, stop-loss points, and profit targets.

  For example, an upward breakout engulfing pattern may be seen as a buy signal, while a downward breakout engulfing pattern may be seen as a sell signal.


3. What signals can candlestick charts release?

  - Reversal Signals:

  Hammer: Appears in a downtrend, possibly indicating a bottom reversal.

  Hanging Man: Appears in an uptrend, possibly indicating a top reversal.

  Engulfing Pattern: One real body completely encompasses the previous one, possibly indicating a trend reversal.

  Doji: A very small real body with long shadows, indicating market indecision and potential trend changes.

  - Continuation Signals:

  Bullish Gap: In an uptrend, the current candlestick's real body is higher than the previous one, indicating buyers control the market.

  Bearish Gap: In a downtrend, the current candlestick's real body is lower than the previous one, indicating sellers control the market.

  - Trend Strength Signals:

  Long White Candle: Indicates a strong buying market.

  Long Black Candle: Indicates a strong selling market.

  - Market Hesitation Signals:

  Doji: High market uncertainty, potential trend reversal or continuation.

  Spinning Top: A small real body with long shadows, indicating an unclear market direction.

  - Price Volatility Signals:

  High-Wave Candle: A small real body with long shadows, indicating significant price volatility and a market that may be searching for a new direction.

  - Volume Confirmation Signals:

  Changes in volume can confirm the strength of candlestick signals. For example, a long white candle with high volume may strengthen the buying signal.

  - Pattern Combination Signals:

  Some candlestick patterns require a combination of multiple candles to identify, such as the "Morning Star" and "Evening Star."

  - Trend Line Breakout Signals:

  When a candlestick breaks through a trend line, it may indicate the continuation or reversal of a trend.

  - Support and Resistance Signals:

  Candlesticks testing support or resistance levels can provide signals that the market may turn.

items.title: Understand Depth Charts
items.content:
1. What is a depth chart?

A depth chart, also known as an order book chart, is a graphical representation based on the order book that visualizes the buy and sell orders in the market. It shows the current market liquidity and the distribution of buying and selling forces, reflecting the following information:

Bids: Orders from traders who wish to purchase an asset at a certain price.

Asks: Orders from traders who wish to sell an asset at a certain price.

Price: The range of trading prices.

Volume: The number of orders at each price point (usually represented in the quantity of the asset or the total amount of funds).

The depth chart is typically divided into two parts:

The left side represents bids (demand), which are the prices buyers are willing to pay.

The right side represents asks (supply), which are the prices sellers expect to receive.

 

2. Components of a depth chart

- Horizontal Axis (Price):

The horizontal axis displays the range of trading prices, arranged from low to high.

- Vertical Axis (Order Volume):

The vertical axis shows the cumulative order volume at each price point, reflecting the supply and demand situation in the market at that price.

- Bid Curve (Buy Orders/Bid Depth):

An ascending curve that represents the cumulative volume of buy orders in the market. The closer to the center, the higher the bid price, and the more likely it is to be executed.

- Ask Curve (Sell Orders/Ask Depth):

An ascending curve that represents the cumulative volume of sell orders in the market. The closer to the center, the lower the ask price, and the more likely it is to be executed.

- Middle Area (Spread):

The non-overlapping area between bids and asks is called the spread.

Bid Price: The highest bid price.

Ask Price: The lowest ask price.

A smaller spread indicates a more active market with lower trading costs.

 

3. How to read a depth chart?

- Understanding buying and selling forces

Strong buying force: If the bid curve is steep and has a large cumulative volume, it indicates strong market demand.

Strong selling force: If the ask curve is steep and has a large cumulative volume, it indicates significant market selling pressure.

- Observing price support and resistance

Support level: A dense area of bids (e.g., a large number of orders concentrated at a certain price), which means that price may act as support during a decline.

Resistance level: A dense area of asks (e.g., a large number of orders concentrated at a certain price), which means that price may act as resistance during an increase.

- Judging market depth

Good depth: Even distribution of buy and sell orders, strong market liquidity, and relatively stable price fluctuations.

Poor depth: Sparse orders, susceptible to the impact of large orders, leading to significant price volatility.

- Identifying abnormal orders

If there is an unusually large order at a certain price point (commonly referred to as a "wall"), it may indicate market manipulation or a significant price level.

 

4. Practical applications of depth charts

- Seeking trading opportunities

If the bid curve is steep and close to the ask curve, it may indicate an impending price increase (buyers in control).

If the ask curve is steep and close to the bid curve, it may indicate an impending price decrease (sellers in control).

- Analyzing market liquidity

Depth charts can help traders judge the liquidity of the market:

High liquidity: Many orders in the market, suitable for large transactions.

Low liquidity: Few orders, prone to slippage.

- Identifying fake orders

In some markets, traders may place spoof orders, creating market sentiment with a large number of orders. For example: A sudden large number of sell orders may push down the price, but these orders may be canceled before execution.

- Setting stop-loss/take-profit

Based on support and resistance levels, set reasonable stop-loss and take-profit prices to avoid losses or lock in profits.

 

5. Limitations of depth charts

- Unable to predict real-time order changes

Depth charts only reflect the current order situation and cannot predict whether traders will modify or cancel orders.

- Susceptible to manipulation

Some large traders or institutions may use fake orders to interfere with market judgment.

- Displays only part of the market information

Depth charts only show order information, while the actual trading volume and speed are also very important.

- Limited impact on small investors

If the trading volume is small, fluctuations in the depth chart may not significantly affect individual trades.

 

Depth charts in the trading market are intuitive tools for analyzing market liquidity, buying and selling forces, and price distribution. By observing the distribution of bids and asks, traders can judge market trends, find support and resistance levels, and formulate trading strategies. However, depth charts are not omnipotent tools; they need to be combined with other analysis methods for comprehensive judgment.

items.title: What’s the Trading Pair
items.content:
At RWAEX Exchange, a trading pair (also known as a currency pair) refers to two assets that can be traded against each other.


1. Each trading pair consists of two parts: the base asset (Base) and the quote asset (Quote).

  - Base Asset: The first currency in the pair, which is the digital asset you want to buy or sell. For example, in the BTC-USD trading pair, BTC is the base asset.

  - Quote Asset: The second currency in the pair, which is used to provide a price for the first currency and can be either a digital currency or a fiat currency. In the BTC-USD trading pair, USD is the quote asset, used to represent the price of BTC.


2. When you choose to buy the BTC-USD trading pair, it means you are using US dollars (USD) to purchase Bitcoin (BTC). Conversely, when you choose to sell the BTC-USD trading pair, it means you are selling Bitcoin (BTC) in exchange for US dollars (USD).

 

In short, trading pairs allow you to clearly see the price of one asset relative to another and make buying and selling decisions based on that information.

items.content: If you wish to quickly access specific trading pairs, such as BTC or CDC as the base assets, simply enter the corresponding currency in the search bar and click on the star to the left of the trading pair to add it to your favorites. Similarly, if you want to search for a quote asset like USD or CNH, find the corresponding currency in the spot market and click the star to add it to your favorites. In the future, you will be able to conveniently access the currencies you trade frequently, which will improve your trading efficiency.

items.content:
On the trading page of RWAEX Exchange, you can view all pending orders by clicking on "Current Orders." If you need to cancel a specific order, simply click the "Cancel" button next to that order. To cancel all pending orders, you can click the "Cancel All" button, which will cancel all of your unexecuted orders on RWAEX Exchange.

 

Please note that orders cannot be canceled under the following circumstances:

- The order has been fully executed and cannot be canceled;

- The order has been partially executed, and the executed part cannot be canceled.

  - Enter the quantity of the order, or enter the total amount you want to trade, and the system will automatically calculate the corresponding quantity based on the current price.

  - Please carefully review your order information, and submit it after ensuring all details are correct.
